sentences.sContent: If someone invited me over to Florida, I’d jump at the chance (= use the opportunity eagerly ) .
sentences.sCn: 如果有人邀请我去佛罗里达，我会赶紧抓住这个机会。

sentences.sContent: There’s always the chance that something will go wrong.
If we did move to London, I’d stand a much better chance (= have a much better chance ) of getting a job.
sentences.sCn: 如果我们真的搬到伦敦去，我找到工作的机会就大多了。

sentences.sContent: There is little chance of her being found alive.
...Your identity has been formed; you’ve built up your resources; and now you have the chance to take the big risks precisely because your foundation is already secure...
...This is your chance to convey boundless enthusiasm for the subject...
...I’ve got the chance to put on my new suit tonight...
...It was the chance of a lifetime...
...The competitors had a chance to visit the famous scenic spots and historical sites in other parts of China as well...
...the more wonderful chance will be presented for them to be admitted by the famous university...
...to give up the perfection we thought we had achieved for the chance of being even a little bit better...
...It’s a job that certainly offers a chance for public service...
...experiencing things we won’t have the chance to do as well as lives we won’t be able to enjoy...
...there is a good chance of buying a defective product...

synos.tran: 机会，际遇；运气，侥幸；可能性

phrases.pCn: 不容易有的机会；极小的可能性
极小的可能性，不大可能的机会
机会对策；靠技巧取胜的游戏
经过努力奋斗才能获得成功的机会
极有限的一点机会[常用于否定句]

words.tran: 不确实的；偶然发生的；不安的

trans.tranOther: a time or situation which you can use to do something that you want to do
